item.description: Processing used as a tool for exploring the intersection of the physical and virtual in MAS968, a course in computational media design taught by John Maeda, Ben Fry, and Tom White at the MIT Media Laboratory.

Cybersonica 06 Sonic Art Exhibition is now open, in Soho London. The works have been selected for their exciting approaches to creative interactivity. They move beyond the ‘screen, keyboard, mouse scenario’ and respond to physical input, proximity, sound, kinetics, elapsed time and the surrounding environment. Features two Processing works, Shadow Monster and LoopArena. Map & Opening Times | Cybersonica | Pixelsumo coverage

Further Processing is an exhibition at Kunstverein Medienturm, presenting artistic positions using computational and generative processes. The Processing tool and its extended community serves as a nexus for the exhibition, connecting both the artists and their creative strategies. Artists include Pablo Carranza, Fabio Franchino, Ben Fry, Golan Levin, Lia, Mark Napier, C.E.B. Reas, Karsten Schmidt, Martin Wattenberg and Marius Watz. The show is part of the Steirischer Herbst festival, and is co-curated by Sandro Droschl and Marius Watz.

Art Audience & Skin Color DANE PICARD Computer Viewer-Presence Installation
Dane Picard's installation, "Art Audience & Skin Color", utilizes open source project Processing to average the viewers skin color in the gallery over the course of the exhibition. All data will be collated in real time, making up the content of the exhibition.
